activities: Routine handling of human resources related information of Biomedical Systems employees and contractors residing in the E.U.  Data collected in the E.U. and transferred to the U.S. for pharmaceutical clinical trials.  Retail sales information regarding medical devices manufactured by Biomedical Systems and marketed in the E.U.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources
recoursemech: For complaints that cannot be resolved between Biomedical Systems and the complainant, Biomedical Systems has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the European data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Principles.
